dmca.title: Fox wants Borat banished from blog
dmca.body:
Attention Google Legal Support:

On behalf of Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation and/or its
subsidiaries and affiliated companies ("Fox"), I am writing to notify
Google of the infringement of Fox's intellectual property rights in
the above-listed television series on the http://www.blogger.com
website and to demand that Google take immediate action to stop such
infringements.

The below links are specific examples of http://www.blogger.com web
pages linking to video files that infringe upon Fox's intellectual
property rights. These files were posted on
http://movieshowofweek.blogspot.com/. Fox hereby demands that Google
promptly remove and disable the links to all unauthorized copies of
works whose copyrights are owned by Fox on the http://www.blogger.com
website of which it is aware, including the infringing files
identified below:

BORAT

http://movieshowofweek.blogspot.com/2007/02/borat.html

EPIC MOVIE

http://movieshowofweek.blogspot.com/2007/02/epic-movie.html

ERAGON

http://movieshowofweek.blogspot.com/2007/02/eragon.html

NIGHT AT THE MUSEUM

http://movieshowofweek.blogspot.com/2007/02/night-at-museum.html

RENO 911 MIAMI

http://movieshowofweek.blogspot.com/2007/02/reno-911-miami.html

TURISTAS

http://movieshowofweek.blogspot.com/2007/02/turistas-turistas-parts-1-2-3-4-watch.html

The undersigned has a good faith belief that use of the materials in
the manner described herein is not authorized by Fox, its agent, or
the law. The information in this notice is accurate. Under penalty of
perjury, the undersigned is authorized to act on behalf of Fox with
respect to this matter.

[private]
Counsel, Content Protection Litigation
Fox Group Legal
[private]
Los Angeles, CA 90067
Tel: [private]
Fax: [private]
[private]@fox.com
